reviews.review_msg: The material can be tough but he was really funny so i didn't mind going to his lectures. I recommend taking BUS251 with him. :)

Go to class and just copy the notes, don't expect to understand it right away as you will be able to learn what you will need in the assignments. He will give you lots of practices (including MT's and Finals). Do as much as you can and start from the most recent ones. Easy A

Nice prof. BUS 100 was a joke anyway so having a caring guy lecture for an hour about how we should "chase our dreams" was honestly very enjoyable. At the very least, he was inspiring and was there to help with any questions.

This course was a pass/fail course that prepares you for Beedie. The lectures consists of choosing concentrations, which "choose MIS concentration" was repeated throughout the course and it was not a topic that interests me. Launch was the mandatory orientation where a good amount of time was spent on SDI, which I found a waste of time.

Honestly the lectures are just common sense so if you don't go it's not that big of a deal. But if you're planning on talking don't go, it's so sad when he has to stop when people talk over him. 

Easy course, there's like a couple assignments and they're for completion. Overall don't stress, Kamal is great and tries to keep us entertained.

BUS 100 is a pass or fail course that introduces you to Beedie. The assignments are surveys (I completed them during lectures), so if you complete all the assignments, you will not fail. Although the information Kamal presented in lectures was dry, he was funny and added personal anecdotes that made things interesting.
course isn't that useful, its just an information session about beedie almost every lecture with "real world" methods of job prospecting.
Can totally tell she teaches fitness as well. So focused!
He doesn't explain the instructions well. Doesn't provide feedback, and his class isn't well organized. If you want to learn about the subject avoid taking lessons with him

This is a pass/fail class, very easy, he clearly wants everyone to pass, and gives extra opportunities to those who are failing and need a boost. The lectures are great, and he explains his own experiences at SFU and his career path, which is very inspiring. He is not just a great prof, but a great person.
He's a cool guy, very nice. The class itself is fairly easy as it is only 1 credit and very few assignments, lectures are good not too boring and he's very open to chatting with students
Really cool guy. Lectures were boring but that's just how the class is so cant blame him.
Super cool guy! Funny and chill. Loves Star Wars
